intro: Lonicera lanceolata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and glossy, giving it its varietal name "glabra." The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. These flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
